result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence W Morrissey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligently Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause or Likely to Cause Bodily Harm, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $243 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward LM.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

charges.descr: Negligently Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause or Likely to Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence W Morrissey

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney David Karpe.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 09:15 am.
